segments.text: I see the boy on the stool, and I can’t believe how reckless he’s being.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is clearly about to tip over, and he doesn’t even seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for a cookie, like it’s the most normal thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is drying a plate, completely unaware of the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t stand seeing things like this—it’s so careless and dangerous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is overflowing, the floor is getting slippery, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is going to fall, and the girl is going to get in trouble too.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish someone would just step in and fix everything before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is one of those scenes that makes me so frustrated.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how oblivious everyone is to the dangers around them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I’m watching a train wreck in slow motion.
segments.speaker: PAR
